node.title: Canned Cocktails From the Experts at Death & Co.
node.description: In collaboration with Crafts Spirits Cooperative, the company has produced three drinks based on their original cocktails.

node.title: Paul Thomas Anderson Goes Back to the Valley With ‘Licorice Pizza’
node.description: The auteur explains why he cast Alana Haim, and why he thinks the age difference in the film’s central relationship shouldn’t matter.

node.title: Why Was This Ancient Tusk 150 Miles From Land, 3,000 Feet Deep?
node.description: A discovery in the Pacific Ocean off California leads to “an Indiana Jones mixed with Jurassic Park moment.”

node.title: A Spirit of Gratitude Is Healthy for Society
node.description: On Thanksgiving, consider the multiple benefits of giving thanks.

node.title: How Fake News on Facebook Helped Fuel a Border Crisis in Europe
node.description: Social media worsened a migrant crisis on the border of Belarus and Poland and helped smugglers profit off desperate people trying to reach Europe.

node.title: After 20 Years, Frank Stella Returns to Ground Zero
node.description: The installation of his sculpture marks a homecoming for the 85-year-old artist, whose diptych at the World Trade Center was destroyed on 9/11.

node.title: Nathan Johnson, Modernist Black Architect From Detroit, Dies at 96
node.description: He opened his practice in the 1950s, and his first commissions were the city’s Black churches, which he transformed into modernist temples.

node.title: How Dr. Fauci and Other Officials Withheld Information on China's Coronavirus Experiments
node.description: The reluctance of Dr. Fauci and other NIH officials to be forthcoming with information that could shed light on the origins of COVID-19 illustrates the old Watergate-era saw: The coverup is often worse than the crime.

node.title: These Are the Victims Who Died at the Waukesha Christmas Parade
node.description: Waukesha Police Chief Dan Thompson identified the suspect as 39-year-old Darrell Brooks.

node.title: Black Woman Shot in Back By White Cop Drops Charges After Mediation Session
node.description: Julia Crews, 39, shot Ashley Fountain Hall on April 23, 2019, after Hall was accused of stealing from a local grocery store in Ladue, Missouri.

node.title: 16-Year-Old Trio Charged With Attempted Murder in Shooting of 3 Outside Colorado School
node.description: Aurora Police Chief Vanessa Wilson told reporters that the three injured students are expected to survive.

node.title: Suspect in Murder of Couple Is Brother of Man Who Stabbed Officer Near Pentagon: Police
node.description: Matthew Lanz, 22, is the younger brother of Austin William Lanz, who fatally stabbed a Pentagon police officer in August.

node.title: Free E-Bikes for Everyone!
node.description: We’re in the middle of a climate crisis. We need big ideas.

node.title: I Live in Arkansas, Not Tel Aviv. Why Is My State Telling Me Not to Boycott Israel?
node.description: I publish The Arkansas Times. We refused to sign an anti-B.D.S. law because it violates our First Amendment rights.

node.title: $15 Minimum Wage for Federal Contractors to Start in January — Here's Who May See a Raise
node.description: The Department of Labor estimates half of the workers who will see a pay increase are women, 25 percent are Hispanic and 15 percent are Black.

node.title: Trump-Backed Senate Candidate Sean Parnell Accused of Hurting Wife, Loses Custody Fight
node.description: "He tried to choke me out on a couch and I literally had to bite him [to get free]," she said in court. "He was strangling me."

node.title: Ex-Trump Lawyer Michael Cohen Ends Home Confinement, Takes Swipe at Former Boss
node.description: The disbarred lawyer was serving a three-year prison and home confinement sentence, and will now serve a three-year term of supervised release.

node.title: St. Louis, Omaha Newspapers Among Those Eyed for Purchase by Alden Capital Hedge Fund
node.description: Alden Global Capital, one of the country's largest newspaper owners known for cutting costs, has offered to buy local newspaper chain Lee Enterprises.

node.title: Find the AFL draft prospect that would be perfect for your team
node.description: Does your AFL team need a new full forward? An explosive midfielder? An intercepting gun? Use our interactive tool to see which players fit the brief.

node.title: Whale satellite tagging project blows migration assumptions out of water
node.description: Whales from New Zealand waters break all the rules on their migration path — heading west to Australia instead of to the South Pole.

node.title: Australian MPs fight Chinese bid to join Interpol's governing body
node.description: Several Australian politicians are fighting to block a Chinese official from Interpol's executive committee, fearing Beijing may use the crime fighting body to target political dissidents.

node.title: More disability carers expected to reject mandate than expected
node.description: More disability care workers than previously anticipated are now expected to be stood down next week once vaccine mandate is implemented.

node.title: GOP Senate candidate loses custody battle; was accused of abuse
node.description: Parnell and Laurie Snell had each sought primary custody of their children in court.

node.title: Judge clears the "Groveland Four" — 72 years after false rape claim
node.description: A Florida judge has exonerated the "Groveland Four" — four Black men who were falsely accused of attacking and raping a White teen at gunpoint in 1949.

node.title: Taylor Swift Earns Her Fourth No. 1 in 16 Months With New ‘Red’
node.description: “Red (Taylor’s Version)” had the equivalent of 605,000 sales in the United States. On next week’s album chart, Adele’s “30” is expected to reach or exceed one million sales.

node.title: Review: Channeling Anger in ‘A Girl Is a Half-Formed Thing’
node.description: Annie Ryan’s stage adaptation of the Eimear McBride novel is given a lucid and intimate revival at the Irish Repertory Theater.

node.title: Voicemail Warns School Board 'We're Going to Find You' Over Mask Mandate
node.description: The Moore County School District said it reported the threatening voicemail to law enforcement in September.

node.title: Biden Administration says, 'No Decision' Made on Whether to Tap U.S. Oil Reserves
node.description: Americans have been dealing with high gas prices, which averaged $3.409 per gallon on Monday.

node.title: Greg McMichael's Attorney Suggests Ahmaud Arbery's Actions Also to Blame For Death
node.description: Defense attorney referred to Arbery as a "recurring nighttime intruder" in her closing arguments and pointed fingers at Arbery for his own death.

node.title: Ex-Raider Henry Ruggs Avoids Jail Time After Missed Alcohol Test, Given 2 Ankle Monitors
node.description: Ruggs on Monday was ordered to wear a continuous alcohol monitor on one ankle and a GPS monitor on the other by a Las Vegas judge.
